info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 13 at 2:46PM PDT until March 15 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * CHANGES...Updated to remove the Monday wording for snow levels and amounts. Slightly higher snow levels Tuesday. * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Additional snow accumulations 2 to 6 inches for communities along US-395 including Bridgeport and Lee Vining, with 1 to 2 feet around June Lake and Mammoth Lakes and 2 to 4 feet along the crest above 8500 feet. Sierra ridge gusts above 100 mph. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...Until 5 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible with snowfall rates 2 to 3 inches per hour at times. Snow loading on structures will increase due to the additional rain and snow being absorbed into the deep snowpack, along with higher risks for dangerous roofalanches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will rise between 8000 to 8500 feet on Tuesday, before falling Tuesday night to below 6000 feet by early Wednesday morning. Isolated lightning is also possible during heavier snow.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
